Class Crab

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.Actor
      • Crab
  • public class Crab
extends greenfoot.Actor
    This class defines a crab. Crabs live on the beach. They like sand worms (very yummy, especially the green ones). Version: 5 In this version, the crab behaves as before, but we add animation of the image.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Crab()
      Create a crab and initialize its two images.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description

      Check whether a control key on the keyboard has been pressed.
      void lookForWorm()
      Check whether we have stumbled upon a worm.
      void switchImage()
      Alternate the crab's image between image1 and image2.

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public void act()
        Act - do whatever the crab wants to do. This method is called whenever the 'Act' or 'Run' button gets pressed in the environment.
        Overrides:
        act in class greenfoot.Actor

      • switchImage

        public void switchImage()
        Alternate the crab's image between image1 and image2.

      • checkKeypress

        public void checkKeypress()
        Check whether a control key on the keyboard has been pressed. If it has, react accordingly.

      • lookForWorm

        public void lookForWorm()
        Check whether we have stumbled upon a worm. If we have, eat it. If not, do nothing. If we have eaten eight worms, we win.
